info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 4:17PM PDT until August 04 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Klamath County in south central Oregon... * Until 445 PM PDT. * At 415 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Rocky Point Upper Klamath Lake, or 23 miles northwest of Klamath Falls, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Rocky Point Upper Klamath Lake and Malone Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows. If on or near Upper Klamath Lake, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
